document_data.name: The Brown Horse
document_data.mainbody: The '''Brown Horse''' was a [[tavern]] in [[Thundertree]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The tavern was located to the northwest of the village, close to its entrance.
document_data.Structure:
Its exterior was well-kept, even after the eruption of [[Mount Hotenow]] in [[1451 DR]]. The intact, stony wall had a sign close to the entry door of a horse holding a tankard of ale.

The building was split into two sections: its eastern side housed the common room, whilst its western side housed the brewing canisters and kitchen.
document_data.Services: The Brown Horse was well known for it brilliant [[ale]], and the tavern itself smelled of brewer's [[yeast]].
document_data.History: After the eruption, when the owners had been driven out or killed, [[ash zombie]]s took residence in the tavernâ€”some even gathered under the bar.
